global.volume: Adjusts the overall volume of the synthesizer
global.pan: Controls the stereo positioning of the sound

impulse.gain: Controls the volume of the impulse exciter
impulse.decay: Controls the decay time of the impulse exciter

resonator.pitch: Set the pitch of the resonator with respect to the current MIDI note. The resonator will produce sound at this frequency, and will resonate strongly with any harmonically related input signals.
resonator.frequency: Set the absolute frequency of the resonator, unrelated to the current MIDI note. The resonator will produce sound at this frequency, and will resonate strongly with any harmonically related input signals.
resonator.keytrack: If enabled, the resonator can be tuned with respect to the current MIDI note. Otherwise, the resonator can be tuned to a constant frequency.
resonator.decay: Adjust the decay time of the resonator. Lower values correspond to stronger damping and a shorter note. If set to zero, the resonator will be bypassed entirely and the exciter signal will pass through to the post filter.
resonator.gain: Controls the gain of the resonator

resonatorbank.inputgain: Set the gain of the input signal to the waveguide bank
resonatorbank.outputgain: Set the gain of the waveguide bank's output
resonatorbank.inputmix: Mix between the exciter signal and the previous waveguide bank's output signal. Has no effect on the first waveguide bank.
resonatorbank.coupling: Set the coupling mode employed by this waveguide bank. In parallel mode, each resonator is excited individually by the input signal. In interlinked mode, the output of all resonators is fed into the input of each resonator. In cascade mode, the output of the nth resonator is fed into the input of the n+1th resonator.
resonatorbank.cascadeamount: Set the level of each cascade signal between adjacent resonators. The output of the nth resonator will be multiplied by this amount before being fed into the n+1th resonator.
resonatorbank.cascadefiltercutoff: Set the cutoff frequency of the filter applied to each cascade signal.
resonatorbank.cascadefilterresonance: Set the resonance of the filter applied to each cascade signal. Higher values produce a more pronounced peak at the cutoff frequency.
resonatorbank.cascadefiltermode: Sets the mode of the cascade signal filters. A mode of 0 corresponds to a lowpass filter, a mode of 0.5 corresponds to a bandpass filter, and a mode of 1 corresponds to a highpass filter. Intermediate values interpolate these extrema.
